response: "{ \"title\": \"Divisor Sum\", \"description\": \"Given a positive integer n, write a function `divisor_sum` that calculates the sum of all proper divisors (excluding itself) for each number from 1 to n.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef divisor_sum(n: int) -> list:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `n` (int): A positive integer.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns a list of integers, where the i-th element is the sum of all proper divisors for the i-th number from 1 to n.\", \"code\": \"\\nimport math\\n\\ndef divisor_sum(n: int) -> list:\\n    def calculate_divisor_sum(m: int) -> int:\\n        total = 0\\n        for i in range(1, math.isqrt(m)):\\n            if m % i == 0:\\n                total += i + m // i\\n        return total\\n\\n    result = []\\n    for i in range(1, n + 1):\\n        result.append(calculate_divisor_sum(i))\\n    return result\", \"tests\": [\"assert divisor_sum(10) == [1, 1, 2, 4, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10, 16]\", \"assert divisor_sum(20) == [1, 1, 2, 4, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10, 16, 12, 14, 18, 20, 22, 24, 28, 30, 32, 36]\", \"assert divisor_sum(5) == [1, 1, 2, 3, 4]\"] }"
